title: Hotfix: Turret plating gold nerf and Drake nerfs
body:
From Mark Yeeter

https://twitter.com/MarkYetter/status/1199122647910514688

**Elemental Dragons**

* Dragon Gold 100g to killer ->25g to killer

* Ocean Dragon healing 5% Missing health -> 3% Missing health

**Turrets**

* Turret plating gold 160 -> 120 per turret plate

* Turret plating Armor/MR per missing plate 30 -> 40

replies.body: I'm so stunned Riot would make changes to improve the game that I can't come up with a witty remark. I hope this is the start of a trend.
You'll find a way, believe in yourself
Idk, i'll give them the benifit of the doubt once they finally do the right thing for toplane (aka fix the matchups)

Bear in mind that I don't mind any of those changes

but what  the fuck?

We played the entire season 9 with 160 golds on turret plating, and suddenly they decide to hotfix the bounty in season 10?
I can't understand their thinking pathern
I think it's becoming of bot lane became a camping site? I can't think of anything else

even if it were the case (didn't witness that in game), the point of turret plating is to snowball, by doing this riot is essentially telling us "we want less snowballing, longer game, slower pace games"

which I don't mind, but it's weird to have a **HOTFIX** for that when we played the entire season 9 like that.

All the souls are game-breakingly bad.

The earth soul is basically a never ending barrier that also refreshes and scales with ap and ad.

The infernal soul is basically every 3rd hit you take extra damage and its large chunk and it also procs off minions/dots, seen a zyra plant solo people during her ult.

The cloud soul is spear of shojin but for every champion active always and a massive move speed boost.

The ocean soul is basically warmogs that is always active long as you are in combat or doing damage to stuff.

The souls are all busted to shit and the team with 4 dragons will almost always win.

"The team with 4 dragons will almost always win" thats kinda the point. Its also a self fulfilling prophecy, the team that kills more dragons is more likely to win just because of map control required to take 4 dragons, the buffs are largely irrelevant to this.

They changed the goal of the game from "kill the enemy nexus" to "take dragons". 

That's kind of a fundamental flaw with the changes.

Also, map control is rarely the leading factor. Which lanes won is a much larger factor than what the jungler was doing in any decent MMR or above. 

Prio =/= map control, and Prio is what leads to dragons 9/10 times.

> [{quoted}](name=WoonStruck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tqEEx1rX,comment-id=0004000000010000,timestamp=2019-11-26T19:23:00.042+0000)

> 
> Prio =/= map control, and Prio is what leads to dragons 9/10 times.

So basically... They changed nothing? Because thats literally always been the league macro. Whoever takes the most dragons usually wins.

Mountain is only out of combat.

Infernal is as big as, if not smaller than a Karthus Q and the damage is rather small. The Zyra you've been referring to must've been beyond fed.

Cloud is pure ms and nimbus cloak passive, the normal drake buff is % ult cdr. What of this is in any way like SoS?

Ocean soul is the only one with a permanent game-deciding impact and should be nerfed.

Also, dragon souls aren't a guaranteed win, it's about an existing lead:

* if the other team has no drakes, the game was decided before they even got the 4th drake.

* if it's 3:4 drakes the soul is the reward for winning a toe-to-toe battle, hardly game deciding since both teams get decent passive buffs.

* if the team with 4 drakes is somehow behind and didn't leave any drakes to the other team, it's not a guaranteed win either.

So no, the soul is less a free win. The win is a product of an existing lead which has been played into a dragon soul advantage.
If you want to complain about a game deciding neutral buff, then elder. Games are over as soon as it's taken.

LOOOOOL.
How is taking the gold away from Dragons instead of nerfing buffs and souls going to fix the issue?
If anything this puts junglers even farther behind...
Why are we nerfing dragon gold? Like why not remove it 25 is basically nothing.

If you ever need 50 gold.

Try destroying the enemy nexus.
To make sure Dragon cheesers dont get a shitload of income from it.

I'm starting to think they want to make games snowbally but pretend not to. The season changes wouldn't make sense otherwise.

More objectives, more Dragon buffs, Dragon souls, Dragons hp nerf, double Herald, solo exp buff, duo exp nerf, jungle xp nerf.
ALL of this changes favor snowballing and what they do to reduce it? They don't nerf Drake buffs or Dragon souls or Herald Damage, they remove gold from Drake, which is actually ONE MORE STEP to avoid comebacks.

You're buying all of their lies and you make a war of the poor between laners and junglers.

If they really wanted to avoid snowballs they would have made the opposite changes to the exp across the map and to jungle in particular. Make Dragons twice as hard to take so they're always a team effort and there is ACTUAL TIME TO CONTEST THEM. Reduce the exp gap between roles so anyone can fight anyone instead of relying on mid to do everything, reduction of solo lane exp would also reduce how much you behind if you get ganked and miss 2-3 minion waves. Nerf Dragon Souls, nerf Herald damage. Make the jungle slower, less safe but more rewarding so ganking really becomes a tradeoff.

They lie to you people! They did everything they possibly could to make games end faster but you can't read between the lines and you let the sugar coating of it all distract you from the bigger picture.
Dragon is worth less than a single minion wave.  1/2 of one lategame.... I'm sure that was the problem...

It was when early dragon cheesers get a free scuttle's worth of gold+dragon buff at level 4. That let them snowball beyond just gaining the buff, and just because they picked a select few of the junglers that can easily solo early.
